title: Getting Started with R at Te Kaunihera o Tāmaki Makaurau
text: Kia ora, congratulations choosing use R programming language Te Kaunihera o Tāmaki Makaurau (Auckland Council)!

what: Wait, why should I learn R?
title: Getting Started with R at Te Kaunihera o Tāmaki Makaurau
text: ’s great question! ’re probably familiar using Excel working data. Excel powerful versatile tool access , ’m guessing ’re see limitations software: Things can go wrong easily: simple mouse click can change important data; stray keyboard entry can erase crucial formula cell B:16, without value need cell AB:16 won’t show. Nobody wants . can’t reproduce things: work put preparing beautiful pivot table year’s data? ’ll need lot copying, pasting, tweaking get working next year’s data. Plus: understand everything cells work. keeps crashing: spreadsheets get bigger bigger, start adding pivot tables charts kinds things, ’s going take load onto screen, run risk losing everything crashes ’re making important changes. changes things unexpected ways: pasted dates Excel thinks numbers, numbers thinks dates. kind thing can literally cost lives. feels like ’re fighting tool, feels like ’s taken long need, ’re right place. choosing work data R, ’ll experience many benefits time: ’re control: R keeps data analysis separate data ; means ’re never danger losing data accidentally changing data, never need open data file begin . R script isn’t ’d intended, sweat: just change script, knowing original data source remains untouched. don’t need re-invent wheel every time: R built functions, functions can used multiple times achieve similar outcomes different data sources. can write single script load data set, tidy , produce beautiful charts, output files need. need charts files next year’s data, just point script data instead… ’re done! get good stuff, can even write functions; magic! ’s going give computer hard time: R read kinds data files, matter big . ’s programming language specifically designed work lots data, scripts write just little files text ’re going lose work file crashes. tell : comes back first point; ’ll working data using code choose use R, means perform operations tell : mysteriously re-formatted cells! Best , R completely free! ’s also supported huge community users around world happy help, best learning materials free well. Oh, mention created right Tāmaki Makaurau 1990s? Ross Ihaka (Ngāti Kahungunu, Rangitāne) thank . 2022 profiled Te Ao Moana show, can watch :

what: Alright I’m convinced, how do I get started?
title: Getting Started with R at Te Kaunihera o Tāmaki Makaurau
text: Ka rawe, ’s spirit! Let’s get R R Studio Desktop loaded onto machine. ’ll find Software Centre: just search “R Windows” “RStudio” can’t see . R Windows R Studio Desktop can found Software Centre; versions see might different time writing

title: Getting Started with R at Te Kaunihera o Tāmaki Makaurau
text: Oh, ’s right. R Studio Desktop something called integrated development environment, IDE. ’s just fancy way describing bit software makes easy write R code. don’t install R Studio Desktop, make life lot easier get stuck writing code using R.

what: Sounds good. They’re installed, what next?
title: Getting Started with R at Te Kaunihera o Tāmaki Makaurau
text: ’s good idea set default working directory R Studio. store R code, ’s good one place point R Studio place. First, suggest creating new folder OneDrive name something like “Code”. Next, open R Studio Desktop select Tools top menu, click Global Options. ’ll see screen pop like one , Browse button next default working directory path shows . Go ahead click Browse, navigate “Code” (similar) folder just created click “Open”. can point R Studio Desktop default working directory Global Settings ’s bad idea select “Never” next option “Restore data .Rdata workspace exit” ’re , makes sure ’re starting cleaning slate re-open R Studio Desktop future.

what: Sweet! Can I start writing R code now?
title: Getting Started with R at Te Kaunihera o Tāmaki Makaurau
text: like enthuiasm! Although ’ve made first steps, ’s one thing install ’ll thank future self : Git. isn’t available Software Centre, can download free Git Windows website. Go ahead click big ol’ download button keep hitting “Next” ’s done.

what: Git? Why do I need that?
title: Getting Started with R at Te Kaunihera o Tāmaki Makaurau
text: find saving spreadsheets “version 1”, “version 2”, “final version”, “final FINAL version”, “final FINAL version edited”? Yeah, don’t need anymore use R + Git together. Git keep track files change , need revert earlier version (just consult earlier version understand got code), Git allow . mention ’s free? Open source beautiful thing.

what: Okay, I’ve got R and R Studio and Git. Is there anything else I need?
title: Getting Started with R at Te Kaunihera o Tāmaki Makaurau
text: ’re great, ’ve nearly got everything need. Let’s get cracking R installing first package. Fire R Studio Desktop cons–

what: Woah slow down. What the heck is a package?
title: Getting Started with R at Te Kaunihera o Tāmaki Makaurau
text: Oh, sorry. package bunch code written someone else help things R. R built packages, ’re going using lot . wrote one help kaimahi (staff) get running coding R. ’s called awhina, supports start working R. fact, web page ’re looking built part package. Pretty cool huh?

what: That’s very nice, but isn’t R good enough on its own without these packages?
title: Getting Started with R at Te Kaunihera o Tāmaki Makaurau
text: install R, ’re installing ’s called Base R Core R. upon time code written Ross Ihaka co-creator Robert Gentleman University Auckland, ’s evolved lot since . Still, ’s much base code can , maintained small, dedicated group volunteers; ’s interests base code kinds things may benefit people, ’s packages.

what: So packages are like add-ons to the original R code?
title: Getting Started with R at Te Kaunihera o Tāmaki Makaurau
text: hadn’t thought like , ’s actually insightful.

title: Getting Started with R at Te Kaunihera o Tāmaki Makaurau
text: Oh right, yes let’s install first package! ’ll need write following command console: install.packages("devtools")

what: I have two questions. First, where’s the console?
title: Getting Started with R at Te Kaunihera o Tāmaki Makaurau
text: Ah, yes console window bottom left R Studio. looks like : R Studio Desktop console bottom left

what: Got it. Second question: why do I seem to be installing something called “devtools”? Didn’t you say your package is called “awhina”?
title: Getting Started with R at Te Kaunihera o Tāmaki Makaurau
text: Good spot! ’s right, ’re installing devtools first order install awhina. see, awhina designed kaimahi Auckland Council ’ll never “officially” released. , need special command install ’s available us via devtools package… , can probably guess, “official” release can use install.packages() get one.

what: Installing a package to install a package. Gotcha. But isn’t Awhina where I go for ICT support?
title: Getting Started with R at Te Kaunihera o Tāmaki Makaurau
text: ’s right, probably know “awhina” word te reo Māori means “help” “support”. Similarly Awhina navigate ICT help supports work, awhina supports transition working data R.

what: Alright I’ve installed devtools, so how do I get awhina?
title: Getting Started with R at Te Kaunihera o Tāmaki Makaurau
text: ’s easy, just pop following command console hit Enter: devtools::install_github("lddurbinAC/awhina")

title: Getting Started with R at Te Kaunihera o Tāmaki Makaurau
text: Well friend, ’s . ’ve got R, R Studio Desktop, Git Windows, two handy packages (devtools awhina). next steps beyond scope little primer, although ’s probably one thing might want consider…

title: Getting Started with R at Te Kaunihera o Tāmaki Makaurau
text: Well, always packages install . probably synchronise team’s SharePoint Document Library local machine.

title: Getting Started with R at Te Kaunihera o Tāmaki Makaurau
text: Ah, might team aren’t managing files via SharePoint. probably look . Connected Communities Insights Analysis Team ’s effective way manage files. ’re curious, reach us can advise.

what: Just for argument’s sake, let’s assume we are doing that. Then what?
title: Getting Started with R at Te Kaunihera o Tāmaki Makaurau
text: ’s synchronising bit. order R read data files team working , need available local machine. achieve , navigate team’s SharePoint Document Library click “Sync” option top. looks like : Sync button make files SharePoint available computer may need sign OneDrive machine. ’s done, open Windows Explorer ’ll see “Auckland Council” left, OneDrive folder. Click expand see team’s SharePoint Document Library .

what: Great! Where do I go for further help with all of this?
title: Getting Started with R at Te Kaunihera o Tāmaki Makaurau
text: ’re right place! Browse around website find heaps useful info. page written Insights Analysis Team Connected Communities, ’re always welcome reach us . Good luck friend!

code: library(tere) get_started("tidyverse") #> [1] "You already have these packages installed. Ka rawe!" #> ── Attaching packages ─────────────────────────────────────── tidyverse 1.3.2 ── #> ✔ ggplot2 3.4.0     ✔ purrr   1.0.0 #> ✔ tibble  3.1.8     ✔ dplyr   1.1.0 #> ✔ tidyr   1.2.1     ✔ stringr 1.5.0 #> ✔ readr   2.1.3     ✔ forcats 0.5.2 #> ── Conflicts ────────────────────────────────────────── tidyverse_conflicts() ── #> ✖ dplyr::filter() masks stats::filter() #> ✖ dplyr::lag()    masks stats::lag() #> [1] "All packages installed and loaded. Happy coding!"
